title: When did bans get so draconian?
body:
OK yo you guys i just said the n word in chat in ONE game and got 14 day ban instantly without any chat restriction previously, you guys need to be a hell of a lot better about communicating your stupid harsh penalties. Seriously ridiculous, there is no such thing as hate speech anyway, words are words and are NOT violence, and you liberal snowflakes are ruining america. This is what the damn chat filter is for, turn it on if your feel feels are paper thin.

The system used to be nice and reasonable where it would go from a warning to 1 day then 3 days then 7, 14, 1 month, 3 month, 6 month, perma. That is way more fair and balanced like fox news. Now you just get exploded instantly with zero warning or anything, and now im seeing that the only 2 ban lengths are 14 days and perma? That's literally insane and i feel like i have to start a new smurf to get away from that possibility since people report for everything.

TriHard Cx

replies.body:
It's not stupid.

You used a slur that was used for **hundreds of years** to make people, **mainly slaves**, feel like they were lesser and worthless **because of their skin color**. While that's inappropriate in any situation, it's even **more** inappropriate in a game where you're playing with **complete strangers**.

Further, you're wrong about the ban system. It's always been 10 game chat restriction, 25 game chat restriction, 14 day ban, permanent ban. However, recently (within the past year), Riot has taken a hard line on hate speech, so slurs, homophobic/racist/ableist remarks, etc. can escalate you directly to a 14 day ban.

Please remember that the chat filter and mute button are tools for people to not have to see your toxicity. They are not an excuse for you being toxic. "Well, there's a smoke detector in the store, let me just set it on fire because I want to and there's a smoke detector so".

The system actually did used to be different a while back. I don't remember what it was at first, but for a short time it was a system that added more and more chat restrictions and didn't add suspensions unless it was very serious.

The new system is much better though, and OP shouldn't be using racist terms or hate speech. 

I don't side with either party, but I share more ideals with conservatives than liberals.

If it was different it was long enough ago for me to have absolutely no recollection of it, and not ever remembering seeing any quasi-official hints at it having been different.

Point being, doesn't matter what they are, it hasn't gotten more "draconian" at least recently (years), and OP's entire premise is wrong.

Doesn't have to be too long ago, it could be you simply "missed" it.
The experiment was fairly brief; at most a few months iirc. I'm fairly certain that already after the first week some people managed to amass 1000+ game chat restrictions. If they hadn't reset the chat restrictions when the new system came out, some people would probably still be chat restricted from back then.

Will try to find a more official post.
Edit: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Boqd81O0-upcoming-upgrades-to-chat-restrictions
Doesn't entirely explain the previous system, but there's one line that should easily highlight that the system was a bit different from what we have now:
> Others reform their behavior, but still need to work off hundreds of chat restricted games before learning if theyâ€™d reformed or continued earning punishments.

Around two years ago, the article doesn't have a date on the mobile site.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/new-player-reform-system-heads-testing

True about his premise being wrong, but that doesn't make spreading false info ok, even if it was unintentional. I just thought you (and those reading these messages) would want the info for future reference.

I don't see anything there that says that the punishment system used to be 1, 2, etc day bans. I have been around here for well over 2 years, and my understanding about that time was that was the time they implemented AI (IFS) for the majority of punishments instead of the tribunal which used to be the modus operandi.

I appreciate you trying to provide correct information, but I also hope you appreciate that I would love to see any quasi-official posts (heck, even a boards post from a Red referencing it, etc) that specifically refer to a different punishment escalation pattern in the past.

The link was showing that the system changed without specifics, but without context I can get how that is confusing.

The old punishment system wasn't a specific tier system like it is now, but if you want a bit of insight here is a red post I was able to find quickly explaining why it was what it was with a little insight. On mobile now, if you want something better I can try later when I get home.

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=47571320#post47571320
